text:
Hi all, I have developed a theme following the official CMS Boilerplate <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate>

But since upgrading the CLI to 3.0.9 it seems `{% extends './layouts/base.html' %}` is no longer recognised

so the CLI prevents the upload throwing the following errors:
[ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_header_includes }}.
[ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_footer_includes }}. Needed for HubSpot analytics
you are missing the header and footer includes in your template. those are there to add specific HubSpot scripts that power the website. without them a template can’t be saved/used
Hi!!, I'm trying to change the `readOnlyDefinition` property of `hs_analytics_source_data_1`  from `true` to `false` , this is because the client wants to set up this value, this is possible?
